metadata.title: CVE-2022-48825 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:scsi: qedf: Add stag_work to all the vportsCall trace seen when creating NPIV ports, only 32 out of 64 show online.stag work was not initialized for vport, hence initialize the stag work.WARNING: CPU: 8 PID: 645 at kernel/workqueue.c:1635__queue_delayed_work+0x68/0x80CPU: 8 PID: 645 Comm: kworker/8:1 Kdump: loaded Tainted: G IOE    ----------- 4.18.0-348.el8.x86_64 #1Hardware name: Dell Inc. PowerEdge MX740c/0177V9, BIOS 2.12.2 07/09/2021Workqueue: events fc_lport_timeout [libfc]RIP: 0010:__queue_delayed_work+0x68/0x80Code: 89 b2 88 00 00 00 44 89 82 90 00 00 00 48 01 c8 48 89 42 50 41 81f8 00 20 00 00 75 1d e9 60 24 07 00 44 89 c7 e9 98 f6 ff ff <0f> 0b ebc5 0f 0b eb a1 0f 0b eb a7 0f 0b eb ac 44 89 c6 e9 40 23RSP: 0018:ffffae514bc3be40 EFLAGS: 00010006RAX: ffff8d25d6143750 RBX: 0000000000000202 RCX: 0000000000000002RDX: ffff8d2e31383748 RSI: ffff8d25c000d600 RDI: ffff8d2e31383788RBP: ffff8d2e31380de0 R08: 0000000000002000 R09: ffff8d2e31383750R10: ffffffffc0c957e0 R11: ffff8d2624800000 R12: ffff8d2e31380a58R13: ffff8d2d915eb000 R14: ffff8d25c499b5c0 R15: ffff8d2e31380e18FS:  0000000000000000(0000) GS:ffff8d2d1fb00000(0000)knlGS:0000000000000000CS:  0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033CR2: 000055fd0484b8b8 CR3: 00000008ffc10006 CR4: 00000000007706e0DR0: 0000000000000000 DR1: 0000000000000000 DR2: 0000000000000000DR3: 0000000000000000 DR6: 00000000fffe0ff0 DR7: 0000000000000400PKRU: 55555554Call Trace:  queue_delayed_work_on+0x36/0x40  qedf_elsct_send+0x57/0x60 [qedf]  fc_lport_enter_flogi+0x90/0xc0 [libfc]  fc_lport_timeout+0xb7/0x140 [libfc]  process_one_work+0x1a7/0x360  ? create_worker+0x1a0/0x1a0  worker_thread+0x30/0x390  ? create_worker+0x1a0/0x1a0  kthread+0x116/0x130  ? kthread_flush_work_fn+0x10/0x10  ret_from_fork+0x35/0x40 ---[ end trace 008f00f722f2c2ff ]--Initialize stag work for all the vports.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
